summary: Fraud in federal programs costs the U.S. government billions of dollars and erodes public trust in government. Our prior work shows that agencies and Congress can act to reduce the risk of fraud in federal programs. In this Q&A report, we reviewed agencies' progress in this area. For example, 20 out of 24 agencies we surveyed said that they have a designated entity responsible for...
title: Fraud Risk Management: Agencies Should Continue Efforts to Implement Leading Practices
